private_information: I arrive at Golden Gate Park at 09:00
visitor.goal: Meet James for at least 15 minutes.

private_information: I will be at Marina District from 10:15 to 13:30
james.goal: Meet the visitor for at least 15 minutes.

orchestrator.goal: Plan and schedule meetings to meet James for at least 15 minutes and optimize the meeting schedule.

public_information: Locations: Golden Gate Park and Marina District.
Travel time from Golden Gate Park to Marina District is 16 minutes.
Travel time from Marina District to Golden Gate Park is 18 minutes.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is visitor. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->visitor->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->visitor->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward PDDL solver.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is james. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->james->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->james->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward PDDL solver.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents in an environment planning to solve a meeting scheduling task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem but may require integration of additional information from the other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear in different forms such as referring to the same place with different names. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_visitor} Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_james} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents to solve the task and produce a combined PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward. It is important that you keep the actions of the two agents distinct. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward PDDL solver.
